content.description: Three climbs linked together for full on conditions!  Start up Ravens corner on cracks ,then float out left to the arete. Clip some bolts, place some gear and Voila, first tracks. Be sure to milk the freshies on the right  for as long as you can hang on. would'nt want a core shot. Take Albert to the chains.
content.protection: small standard rack. small cam nest for the crux, between 2nd and 3rd bolt

content.description: A really fun route that protects easily.P.1 Follow a beautiful right facing corner to a ledge on the left (2 bolt ss rap anchor, hidden from below- RH Note). P.2 Go right under the roof with plenty of air below you and finish up a crack to another 2 bolt ss rap anchor.  1 rap down with a 60m. Can be done in 1 or 2 pitches.
content.protection: Standard rack up to a #2 camalot, medium wires, both anchors have 2 ss hangers w/rings

climbs.name: Raven Face
climbs.fa: August 17, 2020-- Ben Miller, John Halupowski and John Rice

content.description: This is a variation on Raven Corner.  Climb up into Raven corner, then step right onto the face.  A fun position above the large central roof.  Climb trending right, staying just right of two bolts.  A third bolt is hidden above, and appears as you crest the face, to protect the upper moves to rappel rings.

climbs.name: Raven Corner
climbs.fa: Ben Miller, John Halupowski and Kyle Hildenbrand, July 1, 2019

content.description: The deep V corner straight up the crag.  Climb the right leaning, right facing crack right of the birch tree.  Up a ramp to the V corner.  Climb the overlap into the corner then enjoy great stemming moves to the top.Raven Face variation:  Step right, out of the corner, and up the face.  A fun position above the large central roof.  Climb trending right, staying just right of two bolts.  A third bolt is hidden above, and appears as you crest the face, to protect the upper moves to rappel rings.  (August 18, 2020)
content.protection: Protects well with a standard rack.  Rap anchors at the top.
content.location: Right of the lowest point of the cliff, at a birch tree is the initial corner/crack.  (See the photo).   The jam crack around to the left is Albert's.

content.description: Named after the second ascent experienced less than "clean" conditions, this discardable little adventure climb sits on the right side of the crag, just to the right of Decker Face. I might've ducked the rope for this one... Pad up a shallow corner, through a short bulge with great holds, and into a quartz scoop. Grovel into and out of the crack and finish up on jugs.

climbs.name: Decker Face
climbs.fa: August 21, 2020  Ben Miller, John Halupowski and John Rice

content.description: A variation to the lower half of Rolf's Amazing Journey.  Start at the bottom of the buttress, twenty five feet right of Rolf's. Climb up the face, passing two bolts and a tricky cam or nut placement, and onto a large ledge.  Pass a third bolt and protect in the horizontal, then move left into the Rolf's crack, and up to the hidden ring anchors under the roof.
content.protection: A couple of small and medium cam placements, bolts

content.description: Great hand jams to a nice sequence over the roof (bolt) and finish up a well featured face (small wire).
content.protection: 1 bolt, RPs, cams .5 to a #2. 2 bolt SS rap anchor
content.location: Left most route. Starts with a finger crack to a hand crack leading to a roof.

content.description: A nice secluded spot with a pleasant approach. A few one pitch climbs that are excellent.
